definition: prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)

sentences.english: Russia accuses Georgia of secretly massing troops for an invasion of Abkhazia.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯指责格鲁吉亚秘密集结军队入侵阿布哈兹。

sentences.english: Russia has dug itself in, basically, into Abkhazia and South Ossetia.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯基本上已经在阿布哈兹和南奥赛梯站住了脚。

sentences.english: Similar troop movements were observed toward the Russian enclave of Abkhazia in the far west of the country.
sentences.chinese: 在阿布哈兹的西端，也有类似的军队行动。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Russia's sending reinforcements to Abkhazia.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，俄罗斯向阿布哈兹派出援军。

sentences.english: Russia’s recognition of South Ossetia and Abkhazia has made things worse.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯对南奥塞梯和阿布哈兹的承认让情况变得更糟。

sentences.english: He also backs the independence of the breakaway Georgian regions of Abkhazia and South Ossetia.
sentences.chinese: 他也是格鲁吉亚独立地区阿布哈兹和南奥塞梯的后盾。

definition: Chechnya, a republic in southwestern Russia/Chechen
